qas.question: How many boroughs comprise New York City?
In what year were the five boroughs combined into one city?
In 2014, what did the census estimate the population of New York City to be?
What is the size of New York City in square miles?
What is the population of New York's Combined Statistical Area?
How man boroughs does New York City contain?
The five boroughs of New York City are named what?

answers.text: Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, the Bronx, and Staten Island

qas.question: All five boroughs of New York City formed into one city on what date?
What is the population of New York City as of 2014?
How many languages are spoken by the people of New York City?

context: Situated on one of the world's largest natural harbors, New York City consists of <a0_0><a5_0>five<a5_0/><a0_0/> boroughs, each of which is a separate county of New York State. The five boroughs – <a6_0>Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, the Bronx, and Staten Island<a6_0/> – were consolidated into a single city in <a1_0><a7_0>1898<a7_0/><a1_0/>. With a census-estimated 2014 population of <a2_0><a8_0>8,491,079<a8_0/><a2_0/> distributed over a land area of just <a3_0>305<a3_0/> square miles (790 km2), New York is the most densely populated major city in the United States. As many as <a9_0>800<a9_0/> languages are spoken in New York, making it the most linguistically diverse city in the world. By 2014 census estimates, the New York City metropolitan region remains by a significant margin the most populous in the United States, as defined by both the Metropolitan Statistical Area (20.1 million residents) and the Combined Statistical Area (<a4_0>23.6 million<a4_0/> residents). In 2013, the MSA produced a gross metropolitan product (GMP) of nearly US$1.39 trillion, while in 2012, the CSA generated a GMP of over US$1.55 trillion, both ranking first nationally by a wide margin and behind the GDP of only twelve and eleven countries, respectively.
